message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, lisinopril, an ACE inhibitor, is the first-line choice of treatment for hypertension in patients with diabetes mellitus and a history of myocardial infarction. It helps to reduce cardiovascular risk and prevent complications associated with hypertension. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that can be used as an add-on therapy. Prazosin is an alpha-1 blocker that is not recommended as a first-line treatment. Isoproterenol is a beta-agonist that can worsen cardiovascular complications in patients with hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a history of diabetes mellitus and a previous myocardial infarction, which makes ACE inhibitors like Lisinopril the first-line choice for hypertension treatment in this case. Hydrochlorothiazide is a thiazide diuretic that may be used as a secondary choice. Prazosin is an alpha-blocker which is not recommended as the first-line therapy for hypertension. Isoproterenol is a beta-adrenergic agonist which may worsen hypertension in this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor and is the first-line choice of treatment for hypertension in patients with diabetes mellitus and previous myocardial infarction. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic and may be used in combination with an ACE inhibitor, but it is not the first-line choice. Prazosin is an alpha-blocker and Isoproterenol is a beta-agonist, both of which are not recommended as first-line treatment for hypertension.

We refer to the American College of Cardiology/American Heart Association Task Force on Clinical Practice Guidelines to answer this question. For patients with diabetes mellitus and hypertension, the first-line therapy is an ACE inhibitor, such as lisinopril. Hydrochlorothiazide is also a common first-line therapy for hypertension, but in patients with diabetes, ACE inhibitors and angiotensin receptor blockers are preferred due to their potential to delay the progression of diabetic nephropathy. Prazosin is an alpha-blocker and is not typically used as a first-line therapy for hypertension. Isoproterenol is a beta-agonist and would worsen the patient's hypertension, and is not used for hypertension treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor and is the first-line choice for hypertensive patients with diabetes mellitus and a history of myocardial infarction. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that may be added as a second-line treatment. Prazosin is an alpha-1 blocker and Isoproterenol is a beta-agonist, neither of which are first-line treatments for hypertension in this patient population.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, Lisinopril is the first-line choice of treatment for hypertension in patients with diabetes mellitus type II and previous myocardial infarction. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic used as an adjunct treatment. Prazosin is an alpha blocker used in some cases of hypertension, but not typically as a first-line choice. Isoproterenol is a beta agonist used in emergency situations to treat severe hypertension or bradycardia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, the first-line treatment for hypertension in a patient with diabetes mellitus and a history of myocardial infarction is an ACE inhibitor such as lisinopril. Hydrochlorothiazide can also be used but is not the first-line choice. Prazosin and isoproterenol are not indicated for initial treatment of hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, Lisinopril is a first-line choice for hypertensive patients with diabetes and previous myocardial infarction. Hydrochlorothiazide can also be used, but Lisinopril is preferred in this case. Prazosin is an alpha blocker, which is not a first-line treatment for this patient, and Isoproterenol is a beta agonist that would increase heart rate and worsen hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, Lisinopril is the first-line choice for treating hypertension in patients with diabetes mellitus due to its ability to protect kidney function. Hydrochlorothiazide may worsen glycemic control in diabetic patients. Prazosin and Isoproterenol are not first-line choices for hypertension.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has both diabetes and hypertension, which makes ACE inhibitors like Lisinopril a first-line choice for treatment in this case. Hydrochlorothiazide is also a common first-line choice for hypertension, but may not be the best option for someone with diabetes. Prazosin and Isoproterenol are not recommended as first-line choices for hypertension treatment.
